sentence.Network_en: Cold is the privation of heat.
It will be the greatest imaginable privation for her to have to leave london.
sentence.Network_cn: 对她来说,不得不离开伦敦大概是能想像到的最大的损失.

sentence.Network_en: They endured five years of privation during the second world war.
sentence.Network_cn: 第二次世界大战期间，他们忍受了5年的贫困生活。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 换言之,《黑梦》这一摇滚文本的真正意义并不在于它通过对现实的拒绝完成了对现实的安抚,而是在这种归避式的救赎中更为深刻暴露了现实的“贫困(privation)”,因为.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Latin privatio(n-), from privat- 'deprived', from the verb privare (see private)

entry.def: If you suffer privation or privations, you have to live without many of the things that are thought to be necessary in life, such as food, clothing, or comfort.

example.ex: They endured five years of privation during the second world war...
example.tran: 第二次世界大战期间，他们忍受了5年的贫困生活。

example.ex: The privations of monastery life were evident in his appearance.
example.tran: 从他的外表来看可以明显看出修道院生活的清贫。

means.word_mean: 2. act of depriving someone of food or money or rights;

auth_sentence.content: We foresaw distress...and privation...no holidays, no new clothes, no concerts.
auth_sentence.res_content: We foresaw distress...and privation...no holidays, no new clothes, no concerts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We foresaw distress...and privation...no holidays, no new clothes, no concerts.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 私人的,个人的,秘密的,私下的

stems_affixes.word_buile: priv单个+y……的,人→个人的→秘密的,引申为有厉害关系的人
private个人的+ly表副词→adv.私下地, 秘密地
deprive[v.剥夺,夺去,使丧失]+ation表名词→n.剥夺,丧失

stems_affixes.value_cn: [不受干扰的]独处,自由,隐私;私生活
stems_affixes.word_buile: priv单个+acy表名词→n.[不受干扰的]独处,自由,隐私;私生活
privi=priv单个+lege法律→有个人法律→特权
priv单个+y……的,人→个人的→秘密的,引申为有厉害关系的人
de去掉+priv单个+e→从个人身边拿走→剥夺
privi=priv单个+lege法律→有个人法律→特权
